reviews.text: Room has a king size bed, nice and clean bath. TV reception was good with several channels to choose from. Why this area? Frankenmuth, Bronner's Christmas mall, Birch run Outlet mall
reviews.title: Worst stay in my life

reviews.text: Just here 4-6-12 The Staff was ok. Fridge did not work, was woke up at 12:30 am with a couple 2 doors down fight screaming cussing to the top of their lungs, and nothing was done about it, complain next morning for a refund on one night say because it says it in the hotel book but because we booked online she said nothing could be done, only offerered a 10% discount on next stay , Not a chance in hell would I stay there again, now I`m taking it up to a higher level with Corp,so she calls back 3days later with a 40% discount I don`t think so . all I want is my one free night ,booked it for 3 nights and left a day early,because of all the problems oh yes there is more
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: One of the best places I've ever stayed at. Price, location, service, attitude...everything was great. The bed was so comfortable.
reviews.title: Awful! HARD, HARD Bed!

reviews.text: I slept for all of 5 hours last night, had to resort to the arm chair. The bed was a twin size, felt like I was sleeping on a slab of concrete! If you order on line, especially with Priceline Negotiator, apparently Baymont Inn Hotel gives you a downgraded room. What is up with that? Does Baymont say… “I’ll show you! Get a room for $20.00 under the retail value price and I’ll put you in ROOM 121 & you’ll sleep on a box of blocks w/ goose down pillow”. I will Never stay @ Baymont Inn again! If it weren’t for the staff, I would have demanded another room. Staff was extremely hospitable & accommodating
reviews.title: Nice place, good price

reviews.text: Checked in to this hotel with our family for the weekend - requested two adjoining rooms when the booking was done a month ago. They could not accommodate this the first night and we stayed in two rooms across from the laundry on the first floor. When we opened the doors, the problems began. Despite the fact that the front desk manager assured us that the cleaning staff spend 25 minutes on each room, they were very dirty. I realized the hotel was at capacity the first night, but the dark wood headboards showed obvious nasty "stains". There was dirt on the walls as well - we went back to the front desk and had the cleaners come in again. We also requested adjoining rooms for the second night away from the noisy laundry. We got them on the third floor - one smoking, one not - adjoining nevertheless. The rooms were just as dirty with stains on the walls, headboards, TV, linen, etc. This time, however, we were armed with Lysol wipes!! Unfortunately when we turned on the air conditioner in the room that wasn't non-smoking, we could distinctly smell cigarette smoke! :(. Since we had requested two non-smoking rooms and there were only 9 rooms rented in the hotel that second night (according to the front desk manager), we were hugely disappointed! We also found a previous guest's opened bag of Doritos behind the night stand, hair all over the floor in the washroom, and other such dirt on the walls. So much for cleaning standards. The beds were hard, and I overhead one guest say it was like "sleeping on a surf board."
reviews.title: Filthy by Frankenmuth!

reviews.text: The pool was nice, but far too small for a hotel this size. There were no towels either, so you had to take them from your room. The included breakfast was frozen waffles, French toast and pancakes ... Lots of milk, juice and coffee however. The breakfast area is WAY too small for this hotel - guests were literally on top of one another getting something to eat.
reviews.title: In this case you get what you pay for...

reviews.text: Although the staff were friendly enough, we would not stay here again. Last year we stayed at the Holiday Inn Express near Birch Run and it was great - it's where we'll be returning next year!
reviews.title: great value for our vacation

reviews.text: Spent two nights at this hotel, as we were in Frankenmuth for a family wedding. It was a disappointment. The rooms were small, made even smaller by the extremely large furniture contained in the room. The carpeting was in some of the worst condition I have seen in a hotel. Yes, we saved money over our alternatives in Frankenmuth. Was the savings worth it? In our case, I don't think it was.
reviews.title: Horrible experience

reviews.text: Spent the week up north and planned a stay in Bridgeport, then to go to Frankenmuth. Booked 6 weeks early online and got a great discount. BAD: Someone let off fireworks outside the door on the second night ( we were there on the 6th and 7th). They were full friday night so it was kind of noisy but was quite after 11 pm. There was a group of men smoking outside the lobby door at night. GOOD: The room was a good size, pool was small but it was 100 degrees outside so it was refreshing. We were right down the hall from the pool. The staff was very friendly, front desk and the hotel maids were extremely friendly and helpfull. We had a great room, and the breakfast buffet was a pretty good selection. Overall a great value, considering it was part of the July 4th week.
reviews.title: Bed Bug Exposure

reviews.text: This was a good hotel for the money. I can't say it was the nicest but some of the harsher reviews I have read are not accurate. The lobby is nice and the rooms are clean. The pool area is nice and well-kept. The beds were comfy and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel could use some updating but it's not gross or smelly or anything like that. The Cracker Barrel next door makes for a good dinner. The breakfast that they serve in the morning is not the greatest but it's free, it's included, and there's something simple for everyone.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the money

reviews.text: I thought I was stuck. I had prepaid my Baymont room, but through them on their website for the 20% discount. Our plans changed due to my wife's twin moving into that area at a different date. Not only did they change my reservation anyway, they kept me in the two-room suite I asked for (I had been there before) AND refunded me the last 3 days of my 6 day booking when we unexpectedly needed to leave early. Wow. Kudos to the staff and manager for that one. We'll be back.
reviews.title: Great value, flexible and friendly staff.

reviews.text: Stayed May 27-28 for a mother/daughter shopping trip. Because it's fairly central between Birch Run & Saginaw, and because it worked well for us in 2010, we chose to return again. The rooms are clean and adequate, continental breakfast is adequate, and staff was friendly. We didn't use the pool, we really only wanted a place to sleep and recharge between shopping days, so this place worked well for that... and probably less expensive than the motels that are right at Birch Run. We'll very likely do the shopping trip again next year, and wouldn't think twice about returning to this hotel.
reviews.title: Handy for Birch Run/Saginaw
NEVER AGAIN!!!!!
reviews.text: Customer service gets a big fat zero. My credit card was charged twice and when I called to have it reversed, I was yelled at on the phone. I couldn't get a word in edgewise. I was the one at fault. I was charged for my room and the room next door and had to call the guest that stayed in the room next door in order for the charge to be reversed. The woman needed a credit card - as if I would have a card number to give them for people next to us. I told them this was there responsibility but she would not refund me without a card number. We did know the people next door but that should have made no difference. The audacity of having a customer do their job. I reserved two reservations and my son paid for his as we did ours. This was for them to figure out, not me. Rudest staff person I have ever encountered. Wouldn't recommend this to my worst enemy. Internet didn't work either. Complimentary breakfast was nasty.

Rudest staff I have ever encountered. We had a baby with us and didn't want to disturb other guests so we asked if there were people in the rooms around us. The desk clerk said she didn't know. Really? You can't look it up? Then my mother in law got charged twice, once for her room and once for a room that we did not stay in. She called to have the problem fixed and got yelled at and told it was her fault. It was just terrible service.
reviews.title: Rudest staff ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here last weekend, had a small problem but didn't complain to management. I received a survey from the hotel, addressed my complaints and heard from the manager personally. It was very nice to be addressed personally and not by a generic email or phone call. I thought it was very good customer service and would recommend this hotel
reviews.title: manager very helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the weekend at the winter festival in Frankenmuth. Chose the Baymont Inn Bridgeport because the accommodations were reasonable and only 8 miles from where the activities took place. The facility was clean and the staff friendly. The continental breakfast was just okay. Because we were going to be at the festival for the entire day, this hotel met our needs. If you plan on spending the day in Frankenmuth and need a clean place to stay at a reasonable price, that's close to the expressway, Baymont Bridgeport will fit the bill.
reviews.title: Winter Getaway

reviews.text: Every once in a while we like take a day trip to Frankemouth, Michigan. This is the second time that we have stayed at the Baymont in Bridgeport. As nice as it might be to stay right in Frankenmouth I prefer a location that is a little bit away from the crowd. The Baymont is located right off I-75 and is a short, easy to navigate drive into Frankenmouth. Another benefit is that it is only 15 minutes away from Birch Run (outlet shopping, with everything under the sun).
reviews.title: Quality establishment, excellent location.

reviews.text: The rooms have been redecorated since our last visit. The new furnishings were attractive, giving the room a high quality feel. Our two queen room had enough room to get around without feeling too cramped. The linens were nice and I remember the comforter being just that, very comforting. It was heavy and warm. We slept soundly, or I was just really tired from all the walking in town.
reviews.title: Ok for a two-night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was always courteous and helpful. The only thing that seemed a little off was when I called the front desk for the local weather forecast. The gentleman seemed surprised by the request, but he did get me the information and was kind.
reviews.title: Yearly Weekend Getaway
